executive_summary: The cosmetic dentistry industry navigated substantial demand changes and cost fluctuations during the pandemic. Many dental offices temporarily shut down, facing declines in demand resulting from stay-at-home guidelines and the postponement of nonessential procedures. Coupled with a high unemployment rate, these conditions led to financial challenges for the industry, including falling revenues and increasing purchase and wage costs, leading to fluctuating profit. However, once the pandemic subsided, consumer demand returned and profit returned to pre-pandemic levels.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: No one smiled while the pandemic postponed elective cosmetic procedures
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, temporary stay-at-home orders and the postponement of nonessential medical procedures to minimize potential exposure to the virus compelled cosmetic dentists to suspend their operations temporarily. Facing high unemployment rates, consumers prioritized saving and spending on essentials, postponing non-essential cosmetic procedures. This change in consumer behavior led to decreased revenue and increased costs for dental practices, resulting in profit declines and unpredictable revenue streams.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Beauty Trends Spur Younger Adults as Demographic Shifts Spur Older Adults to Seek Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Many dentists reported a surge in demand for cosmetic procedures following the pandemic. Consumers spent more time watching themselves on screen through remote schooling and work, highlighting any aesthetic insecurities. Veneers, once reserved for older adults who could commit to the upkeep, have gained popularity among younger consumers. The aging older adult population has brought consumers to cosmetic dental offices. Aging leads to many dental challenges. With appearance and health concerns, revenue from older adults makes up a third of the average practice revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Heightened Competition Spurs Widening of Service Offerings to Consumers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Considered a discretionary expense, cosmetic oral surgery is a reasonable expense to cut from a limited budget. The accessibility of over-the-counter solutions, like drugstore whitening kits, has urged consumers to forgo professional services. These solutions sell themselves on ease of use, at-home application and affordability. Also, many of these solutions have increased the quality of outcomes. Dental practice organizations are strategically evolving, targeting competitiveness in cosmetic dentistry by offering cosmetic treatments, adopting advanced technologies, offering diverse treatment options and implementing cost-sharing models.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE JOURNEY TO A PERFECT SMILE IS NOW MORE NAVIGABLE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As social media platforms like Instagram emphasize near-perfect physical appearances, often edited and enhanced, demand to meet these evolving beauty standards is rising. The cosmetic dentistry industry has responded by leveraging advancements in materials, procedures and technologies. New materials are leading dental restorations that allow more natural-looking teeth. AI models are bringing reliability to implant prognosis. Some dental groups use robotic devices to place implants and 3D printing technology has revolutionized lab procedures, making the production process more streamlined and efficient.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GROUP PRACTICES AND ORGANIZATIONS WILL GAIN MOMENTUM
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The fragmented nature of the cosmetic dentist industry has boosted competition among small practices, which struggle to find qualified dentists amid a dentist shortage. Competition will continue intensifying, driving solo practices to join forces with larger group practices. These group practices will benefit from economies of scale and brand loyalty. Cosmetic dentists can join Dental Service Organizations (DSOs) or Dental Practice Management (DPM) companies to mitigate costs and enhance competitiveness.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: AT-HOME ALTERNATIVES WILL CONTINUE TO SOFTEN GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the improvement in the quality of drugstore teeth whitening solutions and DIY kits, more consumers are inclined to carry out their own cosmetic.

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that primarily provide elective dental services to improve the appearance of teeth, gums or overall smiles. Services include cosmetic crown and bridgework, veneers, inlays and outlays, direct bonding and whitening procedures. Industry services are not generally covered by insurance, making them highly discretionary.
key_trends: At-home whitening kits are reducing demand for professional cosmetic services.
Pushing consumers towards drugstores that offer a variety of advanced whitening products.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Younger consumers have historically accounted for a small share of cosmetic dentists' sales as they generally have less disposable income than older age groups.
Cosmetic dentistry procedures offer a solution for adults aged 31 to 50 who wish to address visible signs of aging.
The segment of the population aged 51 and above is experiencing a longer lifespan.

products_and_services.product_description: Crowns and bridges are dental restorations used to repair damaged or missing teeth.
Direct bonding uses a tooth-colored composite to restore the appearance of chipped or misshapen teeth.
Veneers cover the front portion of a tooth to improve its aesthetic appearance and are made from ceramic layers bonded to the original tooth.
Inlays and onlays are dental restorations used to repair decayed or damaged teeth.
Dental implants use a small titanium screw to anchor a replacement tooth to a patient's jawbone.
Teeth bleaching and whitening services give patients brighter and whiter smiles.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Since cosmetic dental procedures are considered elective, insurance doesn't typically cover them.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest percentage of establishments.
The Southeast, home to over a quarter of the US population, is underserved in the cosmetic dentistry market.
The Mid-Atlantic region features some of the highest household incomes in the nation.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Prohibits offering remuneration to induce services covered by government health programs.
Cosmetic dentists must obtain a state-issued license to practice.

regulations_points.regulation_title: US EPA REGULATIONS AND OSHA GUIDELINES
regulations_points.regulation_description: Regulates the disposal of hazardous waste including mercury.
Safeguards dental patients' privacy and ensures access to dental care.
Regulates dental products used in cosmetic procedures.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The cosmetic dentistry industry is in a mature stage.
Limited industry assistance available for practitioners.

basis_points.basis_title: At-home whitening kits are reducing demand for professional cosmetic services.
basis_points.basis_description: At-home whitening kits are reducing demand for professional services.

basis_points.basis_title: Professional teeth whitening costs have risen.
basis_points.basis_description: The rising costs of professional whitening push consumers to alternative options.

concentration_points.concentration_title: WEALTH AND POPULATION DENSITY INFLUENCE CONCENTRATION
concentration_points.concentration_description: Wealth influences the distribution of cosmetic dentists.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Dentists Limit Purchases and Other Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases of dental supplies have shrunk in recent years as dentists have sought to cut costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Advancements in technology have reduced operational costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Technology advancements have reduced costs and extended the durability of supplies.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Attracting highly skilled workers poses a challenge for new entrants.

volatility_points.volatility_title: An Aging Adult Population Supports Stable Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Older adults support demand for various cosmetic dental procedures.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DIGITAL SMILE DESIGN BUILDS CUSTOMIZED SMILES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Digital imaging technology enables customization of patients' smiles.
Invisalign is a clear aligner system used for orthodontic treatments.

FAQs.question: How much does your company allocate toward marketing?
FAQs.answer: On average, a typical company devotes between 1.0% and 2.0% to marketing.

FAQs.question: Has your company considered opening up operations in urban environments?
FAQs.answer: Many cosmetic dentists have opened practices in urban areas due to growing demand.
